prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
Example:
Question:
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My first client. Just standing in front of this guy makes me nervous...
Character 1
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: The victim in this case. A traveler, only recently back in-country.
Character 2
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecuting attorney. For all his experience, he lacks a certain presence...
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.
Evidence 1
Name: Photograph of Victim
Description: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.
Evidence 2:
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A bottle of carbonated water and a steak lunch can be seen on the victim's table.
Evidence 3:
Name: Medical Report Card
Description: A record of dental work. On the day of the murder, the victim had undergone dental treatment and been prohibited from eating or drinking anything but water.
Evidence 4:
Name: Photograph of Handbag
Description: A photograph taken by Hosonaga-san after the incident occurred. It shows Miss Brett's handbag on a chair by the victim's table.
Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was ingesting a regulation beef steak at the restaurant while having a tactical discussion with the old man.
Person: Nosa
Testimony 1
Testimony 1: Myself, I was extolling the virtues of a particularly fine golden curio to the military gentleman.
Person: Korekuta
Testimony 2
Testimony 2: At that precise moment, a firearm was discharged! I observed the enemy's actions with my own eyes!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 3
Testimony 3: The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 4
Testimony 4: I was on my hands and knees, investigating the where-abouts of my mysteriously absconded precious curio.
Person: Korekuta

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.
Testimony 3 states that the gun shot was fired "from the back". However, Evidence 0, which is "Post-Mortem Report," states that the victim died "from a gunshot to the chest", which implies that the witness is lying.
{"evidence": 0, "testimony": 3}
Question:Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 2
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
Character 3
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
Character 4
Name: Rocco Carcerato
Description: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
Character 5
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 6
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.
Character 7
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
Character 8
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.
Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. [info] The victim had a ring on his right hand, which was covered by a sheet when the body was discovered.  Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensor
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets when they are near by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Recreation time ended around 10 AM.
Person: Elbird
Testimony 1
Testimony: I returned to this room and went straight to my training.
Person: Elbird
Testimony 2
Testimony: Just as I'd counted to two, I heard a voice shout out, "AAARGH! I've been stabbed!"
Person: Elbird
Testimony 3
Testimony: It sounded like someone in pain, calling out for help. But...
Person: Elbird
Testimony 4
Testimony: I couldn't do anything since I was locked up in my cell. So, I went back to my training.
Person: Elbird

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the contradictions between the evidences and testimonies:

Evidence 8 (Prison Roll Call) states that the victim's body had not been found at the 7 AM roll call. Evidence 20 (Autopsy Report) estimates the time of death between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. This suggests the victim died before the 7 AM roll call, but his body was not found during roll call.

Testimony 2 (Elbird) says: "Just as I'd counted to two, I heard a voice shout out, 'AAARGH! I've been stabbed!'" This suggests Elbird heard the stabbing happening.

However, Testimony 4 (Elbird) says "I couldn't do anything since I was locked up in my cell. So, I went back to my training." This indicates he was locked up, and presumably couldn't move from his cell at the time of the stabbing.

Evidence 7 (Door Sensor) states that doors detect the prisoners' bracelets and raise the alarm if inmates are near, and prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.

Combining these: if Elbird was locked in his cell during the stabbing and couldn't do anything, he should not have been able to hear the shouting (depending on the cell layout and soundproofing), or he should have been able to raise alarm or assist. But the key contradiction is that he says he heard the stabbing while counting to two (which implies being at or near the scene), but also says he was locked in his cell (implying a distance or unable to witness).

Alternatively, looking for a more direct contradiction:

Evidence 13 (Wiped Floor) states that blood was wiped from the floor in Knight's cell and confirmed as Knight's.

Testimony 4 (Elbird) says he was locked in his cell and just went back to training, implying no disturbance.

However, if bloody floor was wiped, some disturbance or efforts to clean up happened.

But this is indirect and a stretch.

Looking further:

Evidence 10 (Sahwit's Bracelet) says the bracelet was broken and undetected by sensors.

Testimony 0 (Elbird) says recreation time ended at 10 AM.

Evidence 15 (Security Camera Footage) says the victim was attacked around 9 AM, but footage has a 3-hour time gap.

If Sahwit's bracelet was broken and undetected, yet prisoners can't move freely, contradiction about presence.

But no testimony explicitly contradicts these.

Going back to testimonies 2 and 4:

Testimony 2 (Elbird) says he heard a voice shout, presumably the stabbing occurred.

Testimony 4 (Elbird) says he was locked up and went back to training, implying he did not help or respond.

This shows a contradiction in the witness' behavior and statements.

Alternatively, examine testimonies 2 and 3:

Testimony 2: "Just as I'd counted to two, I heard a voice shout out, 'AAARGH! I've been stabbed!'"

Testimony 3: "It sounded like someone in pain, calling out for help. But..."

Suggesting hesitation or doubt.

But not a direct contradiction with evidence.

Now, consider that the evidence says the time of death was between 3 AM and 6 AM (Evidence 20).

But Testimony 0 says recreation ended around 10 AM.

Testimony 2 says the stabbing was heard while counting to two, no exact time given.

If death was between 3-6 AM, but recreation ended at 10 AM, and presumably prisoners locked in at night, it's unlikely anyone heard a stabbing at 9 or 10 AM.

Therefore, Testimony 2 contradicts Evidence 20.

That is, Elbird claims to have heard the stabbing voices at recreation time (post 7 AM), but autopsy says death between 3 and 6 AM.

Hence, these contradict.

Therefore, evidence 20 (autopsy, time of death 3-6 AM) contradicts testimony 2 (hearing stabbing shout at around recreation time, presumably after 7 AM).

Hence, the pair is Evidence 20 and Testimony 2.

cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies for any contradictions:

Evidence 9 states that Sahwit claims to have seen a black dog biting the victim's throat.

Evidence 20, the Autopsy Report, states that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade, and death was instantaneous.

Sahwit's testimony (Testimony 3) indicates he found the victim lying dead, implying he was the witness to the aftermath but does not directly mention a dog.

Also, Evidence 15 shows security camera footage showing the victim being attacked by a dark form, with a time discrepancy.

However, Sahwit's testimony does not mention any attack by a dog; the evidence is that he found the victim dead.

Another point: Evidence 4 describes a Rubber Glove stained with blood and mud found in Workshop A; Sahwit was using it during his animal styling training, which involved a dark mudpack treatment.

Evidence 10 says Sahwit's bracelet was broken and couldn't be detected by the prison's sensors at the time of the incident, which could allow movement unregistered.

Testimony 0-4 are all from Sahwit, mostly about his actions and reactions upon finding the body.

Looking deeper for contradiction:

Evidence 5 is a Rope found on top of Knight's body, questioning whether he was tied up.

Evidence 23, "Mr. Saint's Trick," involves a contraption using ropes and weights, with the victim's body replacing the weights.

Testimony from the warden or others regarding the presence or absence of these ropes or the state of the body is missing.

However, focusing on the biggest contradiction:

Evidence 2 (Mr. Knight's Body) says he was killed by a stab wound to the throat, instantaneous death.

Evidence 9 says Sahwit claims a dog bit the victim's throat.

If the victim died instantly by stabbing, the dog biting the throat appears unlikely or at least questionable as the cause of death.

So, Sahwit's claim (Evidence 9) contradicts the autopsy report (Evidence 20).

Looking at testimonies, Testimony 3 is Sahwit saying he found the victim dead.

But the only direct mention of the dog biting is in Evidence 9.

Thus, the contradiction is between the autopsy report (Evidence 20) indicating death by stabbing and Sahwit's claim of a dog biting the victim's throat (Evidence 9).

Since Sahwit's testimony does not explicitly mention the dog, the contradiction is between Evidence 9 and Evidence 20.

The question asks: which evidence and testimony contradict each other — to select a pair of an evidence and a testimony.

Therefore, find the testimony that corresponds to the dog bit claim or at least conflicts with the autopsy.

Testimony 3: "Then I saw him lying there... A man... not moving... dead!" by Sahwit

Testimony 0-4 are all from Sahwit.

Sahwit's testimony does not mention a dog attack, but Evidence 9 says "Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat."

Therefore, Sahwit's testimony seems to contradict the autopsy (Evidence 20).

So the contradiction is between Evidence 20 and Testimony 3 (where Sahwit claims to have seen the dead body, but in Evidence 9 he says he saw a dog biting the throat).

Hence, the contradiction is between:

Evidence 20 (Autopsy report — cause of death stab wound to neck) and

Testimony 3 (Sahwit's claim of witnessing the crime scene with dog bite implication).

cot:
Let's analyze the evidences and testimonies for contradictions.

Evidence 20 (Autopsy Report) states that the time of death was between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th.

Evidence 15 (Security Camera Footage) shows an attack happening around 9 AM.

Testimony 4 (Sahwit) says: "And to my horror, there was a black dog biting his neck!" which presumably aligns with the event shown in the footage.

If the autopsy report is accurate about the time of death, the victim could not have been attacked at 9 AM as shown in the footage and described by Sahwit.

Hence, the Security Camera Footage contradicts the Autopsy Report.
